data.meta_description: 2021 has been a great year for fundraising. In May we launched the Step 2 It campaign to encourage the industry to get active and raise money for our charity…
data.text:
Eight young professionals – all earmarked as future leaders – have just completed a unique three-week tour of businesses operating in the UK furniture and furnishing industry, facilitated by The Furniture Makers’ Company, the City of London livery company and charity for the furnishing industry. Relaunched in 2024 after a five-year hiatus, the Young Professional Industry Experience programme (YPIE) is one of the charity’s educational initiatives that gives a small group of handpicked professionals a comprehensive overview of businesses representing all sectors of the wider industry. This year’s participants were: Ellie Amodio, Claire Anderson, Jess Blake, Lydia Burrows, Gabriella Charlton-Little, Jordan Hargadon, Thomas O'Neill, and Tab van der Lande represented George Smith, Sebastian Cox Ltd, Colebrook Bosson Saunders, HSL Chairs, Race Furniture, Saxon Furniture Limited, Silentnight Group, and Sleepeezee. Their eagerness to learn and grow within the industry is inspiring, and we have no doubt that they will continue to achieve great things in their careers. A special thank you to the hosts, Anti Copying In Design (ACID), Axminster Tools, Blum UK, Colebrook Bosson Saunders, DESIGNER CONTRACTS LIMITED, Ercol Furniture Ltd, Hypnos Beds, Sylva Foundation, William Hands Furniture, Ergochair Ltd, Frogmore Conservation Workshop, part of The Royal Household, G Plan , Halstock Cabinet Makers Ltd, John Makepeace OBE, Ocee & Four Design, Panaz, MillerKnoll, SATRA, Shackletons Ltd, Silentnight Group, Simon Thomas Pirie Furniture, and The Vita Group. Six of the group presented their individual experiences to representatives of the host companies as well as other industry dignitaries at Furniture Makers’ Hall, London on Thursday 25 July, which was followed by a lunch sponsored by Blum UK. Brian Ahern, Master of The Furniture Makers’ Company, said: “The culmination of this unique three-week intensive programme around the UK was a fascinating day. It was wonderful to hear what each person got out from the experience and equally very inspiring. The experience would not have happened without the commitment of our corporate members and supporters, so thank you to all of them.” Read more: https://lnkd.in/eSsYGKBZ Photos by FrameShot.

We are delighted to welcome Jessica Land as our new Regions and Fundraising Administrator. Jessica joins us with a robust background in social action and fundraising. In her recent role as a volunteer Disability Officer at the University of Chichester Student Union, she significantly improved the university experience for disabled students through raising awareness, organising inclusive events, and building supportive networks. Her commitment to enhancing accessibility and fostering community is truly inspiring. Jessica also brings valuable experience from her time as a Fundraising Volunteer with the New Theatre Royal in Portsmouth, where she played a key role in devising a successful strategic fundraising plan and organising a musical showcase event. Please join us in extending a warm welcome to Jessica!

Since Manufacturing Guild Mark holder Bisley Furniture’s humble beginnings in 1931 as a car body repair business, Bisley has evolved into a British success story, transforming the landscape of workplace furniture. Since the 1940s, Bisley has been dedicated to meeting the dynamic needs of various working environments. Today, operating from a state-of-the-art factory in Wales, Bisley produces over 15,000 high-quality items per week. Their furniture solutions are trusted and available in over 50 countries, with esteemed clients like Direct Line, the BBC, and PwC relying on them for office storage and furniture needs. Bisley’s achievements are built on three core pillars: strong relationships, cutting-edge manufacturing technology, and a team of exceptional individuals. With a dedicated workforce of 700 employees, Bisley continuously pushes the boundaries of manufacturing excellence. As a private company, they reinvest all profits back into the business. Since 1989, Bisley has invested over £80 million, cementing its position as Europe’s leading manufacturer of steel storage solutions. Remarkably, 48% of all UK steel storage originates from Bisley. The Manufacturing Guild Mark is awarded to British manufacturers that have demonstrated incredible standards across all areas of the business by successfully passing a rigorous, independently reviewed audit. It assures retailers, specifiers, distributors, and customers that the furnishings they purchase are made with care and that the company they are dealing with has achieved exemplary standards throughout its operations. By meeting the Manufacturing Guild Mark standards, you can be confident that you’re among the best manufacturers in the country. Find out more here: https://lnkd.in/dnnpVDQ

Past Master Dids Macdonald OBE., FRSA and current junior warden Jessica Alexander have both been honoured with the Interiors Monthly Lifetime Achievement Award. Interiors Monthly was established in 2007, the magazine for the furniture and flooring, retail buyers is now seen as a leading magazine in the furniture and flooring sector. The magazine’s awards were announced in its August 2024 issue. Dids said, “Thank you so much for this prestigious award, I am honoured. It’s funny how life has its mysterious shifts and turns. Little did I know that when our own designs were copied so shamelessly over three decades ago, it would lead me on a different career path in life. We have some of the best and most innovative designers in the UK but, sadly, the insidious copycat culture is still a huge challenge impeding growth, costing precious resource to enforce, and causing untold stress. It has been a pleasure to work in this amazing sector for the past three decades”. Jessica said: “I am honoured to be singled out by Interiors Monthly for a lifetime achievement award this year. Thank you. My career in the furniture industry- and more specifically the bed industry – has been a wonderful journey over the past 40 plus years. I am pleased to have been able to make a difference.” Congratulations, Dids and Jessica! Read more: https://lnkd.in/ee-7x6Br

6 weeks to go! The Young Furniture Makers exhibition, sponsored by Tizo - discover the next generation of furniture and furnishing design talent, from budding GCSE students to innovative recent graduates. This exciting event offers a rare opportunity for students, apprentices, and young professionals to showcase their creations to a diverse audience of industry experts, potential employers, and the public. Held at the prestigious Furniture Makers' Hall and the historic Dutch Church in the City of London, this event is a must-visit for anyone passionate about the future of furniture design and manufacturing. Don't miss your chance to be inspired by the designers shaping the future of the industry! Secure your free ticket now: https://lnkd.in/en97MfVa #YFMexhibition #YFMawards
